sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be added to each of the numbers \(6 \), \(14 \), \(22 \), and \(28 \) to make them proportional.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "Lets suppose that the required number is $x $.

Since the numbers $6 + x $, $14 + x $, $22 + x $, $28 + x $ are in proportion, we have
\[
	\frac{\input[s1v1]{} + x }{14 + x } = \frac{\input[s1v2]{} + x }{28 + x }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (6 + x )(28 + x ) = (14 + x )(22 + x )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 168 + x (\input[s2v1]{} ) + x ^2 = 308 + x (\input[s2v2]{} ) + x ^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow x (34 - 36 ) = 308 - 168 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{308 - 168 }{34 - 36 }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow x = \frac{-70 }{1 }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [6, 22], "text": "\text{Four numbers are proportional when $a:b::c:d$, thus, using this result we get\[ \frac{6 + x }{14 + x } = \frac{22 + x }{28 + x }\]}"}, {"data": [34, 36], "text": " Upon cross- multiplication and further simplification we get \[
	x = \frac{308 - 168 }{34 - 36 }
\]"}, {"data": [140, -2], "text": "Further simplification will give us the result as \[x= \frac{-70 }{1 }\] "}]
